author: BuyMeThingsNow

text:
I'm sure you know what you're doing, but I thought it couldn't hurt to warn you that I've had a copyright strike for a BlazBlue theme upload, a game by the same company.

Anyway, nice pick. I didn't realize there was a separate Korean soundtrack, but it still fits the game quite well.

author: lacoot

text: I'm part of the minority who actually prefers the korean version of this soundtrack to Daisuke's original music, though the latter is still very solid. I have to say, I haven't put hours into a fighting game in a very long while, probably not since Super Street Fighter IV. I'll get back into the genre eventually, it's too much fun not to.
author: SupraDarky

text: Speaking of fighting games, I started playing Tekken Tag Tournament for the PS2.  I found it at a local flea market for 5 dollars and I have thoroughly enjoyed it so far.  I really need to play more fighting games as there are so many good ones for the PS2.
author: Eric C.

text: You sure it's not actually the majority that likes the Korean version?
author: ASTCify

text:
I, for one, have listened GG and Blazblue soundtracks way more than I actually played the games. I'm not even a fighting game fan, besides the occasional game for fun in a party.
On a side note, I can't believe it's been almost 1000 entries since the last GG track! Irony of Chaste is excellent among others, it's one of my favorite.
